Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2009 07:00PM goldenmermaid wrote: I found out last Friday that I had bc.  I had an ultrasound done and the thickening wasn't felt or seen even though my GYN had felt something in a different area - a little tiny mass was seen in a different area.  I had a biopsy done a week ago;  Monday I met with my surgeon.   Today I had the MRI and that has been the worse experience so far (2 needles bent while the tech was trying to start the IV.)    She opened a new box and it appears that those 2 were defective.     Everything is happening so fast - less than a week and I've completed most of the tests and have more information in my hands.    My nurse navigator gave me a 3" binder with information/brochures.   Just remember not to research stuff online except for this site.    My doctors said that most of the sites give you the worse cases and post incorrect information. You have earned the right to cry, throw things, yell/scream whatever it takes to get to the point of turning all those negatives into positives.    My GYN called me to talk and has yet to tell me what the pathology results were - I found out from a nurse navigator.     I got rid of a bunch of negative people that were in my life and telling me their sagas everyday (more stress and I really don't care about their lives) - I have positive people supporting me and I am confident in my team and their abilities.    I live alone and my only child lives out of state - it's hard not having someone to talk to while I'm at home or get a hug.   My surgeon walked out with me after my appointment and gave me a huge hug.     Think positive thoughts and cry whenever you feel like it.
Posts.Title: When do I cry? seaofhope one-L
